variants.Description in input context: The E46K mutation increases the propensity of α-synuclein to fibrillize.
The A53T mutation increases the propensity of α-synuclein to fibrillize more than the E46K mutation.

Material used.Description: The experiments were conducted using cell lines expressing wild-type or mutant α-synuclein.

Readout description.Result Description: The E46K mutation increases the propensity of α-synuclein to fibrillize, as demonstrated by increased assembly of amyloid fibrils.
The A53T mutation increases the propensity of α-synuclein to fibrillize more than the E46K mutation, as demonstrated by increased assembly of amyloid fibrils.

Biological replicates.Description: Three biological replicates were performed for each variant.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was run in triplicate.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type α-synuclein was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector was used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: ANOVA was used for statistical analysis.
